snippet: Legislation intended to help protect infrastructure from terrorists is hampered by fears of pressure from advocates who scored a victory against antipiracy bills.
abstract: Legislation is gaining steam in Congress that would authorize the federal government to regulate the security of privately owned critical infrastructure--like nuclear power plants--much of which is controlled by Internet-connected systems and susceptible to being hacked; the legislation is already riven by competing interests and fears, circumstances that have been exacerbated by the Internet lobby's victory against would-be antipiracy measures.
lead_paragraph: Legislation intended to help protect infrastructure from terrorists is hampered by fears of pressure from advocates who scored a victory against antipiracy bills.

headline.seo: Digital Security Bills Bruised by a Lingering Antipiracy Fight
headline.main: Security Bills Bruised by Lingering Fight
headline.print_headline: Security Bills Bruised by Lingering Fight
